H0.text: Mixture is the term that best describes sodium chloride, which is formed when sodium and chlorine chemically combine.

H1.text: Element is the term that best describes sodium chloride, which is formed when sodium and chlorine chemically combine.

H2.text: Solution is the term that best describes sodium chloride, which is formed when sodium and chlorine chemically combine.

H3.text: Compound is the term that best describes sodium chloride, which is formed when sodium and chlorine chemically combine.

A4.text: Sodium chloride , commonly known as table salt, is an ionic compound with the chemical formula NaCl, representing a 1:1 ratio of sodium and chloride ions.

A5.text: Common salt has a 1:1 molar ratio of sodium and chlorine.
